title: Textile, ca. 1790
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: mordant printed by engraved copperplate on plain weave; fabric dyed for red
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 76 x 98.5 cm (29 15/16 x 38 3/4 in.)
Repeat H: 70 cm (27 9/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund
description:
Slightly more than one full repeat of a plate. Printed cotton on red. Landscape: two scenes, one an artist standing at an easel in front of a classical temple and dancers and a musician in front of a classical style pavillion. 
Fabric too narrow for plate: Fabric lengths placed side-by-side repeat pattern straight across.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Medium: cotton
Technique: mordant printed by engraved copperplate on plain weave; fabric dyed for red. Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund. 1980-33-13.
